result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel J Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

No Violent contact with victims listed in the criminal complaint. No use or possession of vaping products. Follow all rules set at home by the defendant's parents. Take a Thinking for a Change course. Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment, conditions and/or counseling recommended by Agent. Make best efforts to maintain/obtain part time employment, full time schooling, or a combination of the two. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons. 

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. Defendant is to obtain his High School Diploma.  If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

timeConds.notes: Community Service to be performed as a condition of probation as directed by agent.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:19 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant Samuel J Weber in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Samuel J Weber.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, his client is attempting to enroll in treatment but the matter is prepared to be resolved.  Atty. Gutierrez requests a plea and sentencing date in about 60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:41 AM Defendant Samuel J Weber in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he has an offer but needs additional time to discuss everything with his client.  Atty. Gutierrez is requesting a further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  No comment from the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

08:43 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Samuel J Weber in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Gutierrez provides an update, he needs additional time for his client to enroll in counseling so he is requesting another further proceedings date.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  State also notes the victims are present in court today and have confirmed the next date they are available as well.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:13 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Samuel J Weber in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes that an amended complaint was filed back on 03/03/2022.  Atty. Gutierrez acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters initial not guilty plea.  Atty. Gutierrez advises he just received discovery and requests some time to review it with his client.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
